meanings.definition: The state or quality of being ionic.
meanings.sent1: The ionicity of the salt made it dissolve easily in water.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the ionicity of different compounds in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The ionicity of the battery was shocking, quite literally!
meanings.sent4: The ionicity of their relationship was evident in the charged atmosphere between them.
meanings.sent5: The ionicity of the situation was palpable, like electricity in the air.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a compound exhibits ionic character.
meanings.sent1: The ionicity of the salt affected its solubility in water.
meanings.sent2: Chemists measure the ionicity of substances to understand their properties.
meanings.sent3: The ionicity of the compound was so high, it felt like a science fiction element.
meanings.sent4: The ionicity of the bond between them was strong, like a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent5: The ionicity of the compound was like a magnet, attracting oppositely charged ions.
